Posts.Content: csp wrote: Okay I know what Lobular Carcinoma insitu is... What does the rest of it mean??  I have tried to google some of the terms and for some reason I can't absorb it or don't understand ?? It is not going to change my decision ,I just feel more in control understanding what is going on, So here it is the Pathology report : -Multifocal loular carcinoma in situ; focal atypical intraductal hyperplasia; florid intraductal hyperplasia; focal sclerosing adenosis,intraductal papillomatosis; aprocrine metaplasia and fibrodenomatoid change (see note) -focal fibrosis,foreign body giant cell reaction Note: Sections demonstrates multifocal lobular carcinoma in situ involving 10 of 21 blocks and focally extending to the margin. There is also focal florid intraductal hyperplasia with one focus of atypical intraductal hyperplasia showing cribform pattern and microcalcifications . (block1). Thank you for any help ~ Hugs, Carrie Radiation Therapy 9/30/2010 Surgery Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
